articles.title: S. Korea Should Not Forget Koreans Watch Them with High Vigilance: NDC
articles.content:
S. Korea Should Not Forget Koreans Watch Them with High Vigilance: NDC
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The Policy Department of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK made public a statement Sunday in connection with the grim situation now prevailing on the Korean peninsula.
					 Growing stronger than ever before at present is the unanimous desire of the nation to break with the inglorious past and write a new history of the north-south relations, true to the noble intention of supreme leader Kim Jong Un, peerless great man. World people are also growing strong in their support and encouragement to it in response to the historic appeal for defusing the danger of war and creating a peaceful environment on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 But even a basic climate for dialogue has not been created as the north-south relations are not freed from the phase of freeze.
					
					 Noting that what is happening at present is very grave, the statement clarified the following principled stand:
					
					 1. The south Korean authorities should stop making willful interpretation of the measures of great significance in the nation's history taken by the DPRK, and wagging their tongues at will.
					
					 The great calls made at the outset of the new year reflect the ardent desire to put an end to the 70-year long national division and build earlier on this land a reunified powerful country, dignified and prosperous.
					
					 But the south Korean authorities backed by their American master are deliberately interpreting and slandering the measures taken by the DPRK, far from deeply studying them and positively responding to them. 
					
					 To cite a typical example, they are slandering the precious historic measures hailed by all Koreans as an "option to get rid of international isolation", "the last resort to have economic blockade lifted" and "a peace offensive aimed at stirring up conflict among south Koreans".
					
					 They have even gone so blind as to term those measures "proposals little different from the past ones", "measures devoid of sincerity" and "sleight of hand to hold initiative".
					
					 It was not out of any calculation that the DPRK took such new measures. It was neither economic difficulties nor isolation and blockade that prompted it to take those measures.
					
					 The undesirable and hostile forces should clearly understand that political isolation, economic blockade and military pressure will never work on the DPRK.
					
					 We have never been benefited from the U.S. nor have we thought the south Korean authorities would help improve the living standard of our people.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should neither misjudge nor make a mockery of the sincere will of the DPRK to put an end to the history of national division, a tragedy being suffered only by the Korean nation in the world.
					
					 2. The south Korean authorities should stop disappointing the nation with their double-dealing words and deeds.
					
					 They are now loudly trumpeting about north-south dialogue and the improvement of the relations.
					
					 The present chief executive has talked volumes, regardless of time and place, about "steadily stepping up preparations for unification," "creating conditions for holding dialogue of any form", "conducting trial operation of cross-peninsula railways" and holding dialogue and negotiations for "opening three channels for people's livelihood, environment and culture" and giving "priority" to the reunions of divided families and relatives, while calling for "putting an end to the 70 years of severance and conflicts". 
					
					 Her loud words are quite different from her practical deeds.
					
					 South Korea has already made it an established fact to conduct Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises from March and Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises from August as planned while creating impression that they have nothing to do with the removal of the danger of war and the creation of a peaceful climate.
					
					 Under the pretext of making full preparations for "taking combined defence posture", south Korea, while currying favor with its American master, has introduced aggression troops including a flying corps of strategic bombers carrying nuclear warheads to its land and vicinity, souring the atmosphere for the improvement of the relations with saber-rattling.
					
					 What matters is that such moves are being pushed forward in an undisguised manner as part of preparations for a preemptive attack on the DPRK in the run-up to the 65th anniversary of the conclusion of the shackling and sycophantic south Korea-U.S. "mutual defence pact".
					
					 3. The south Korean authorities should clearly know that in case they persistently refuse to respond to the call of great significance in the nation's history made by the DPRK, they will not be able to escape a stern punishment.
					
					 Improving and developing the inter-Korean relations is the task of the times which brooks no further delay.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should sincerely respond to our call for opening up a broad avenue to independent reunification by concerted efforts.
					
					 Intolerable and unpardonable are the incompetent behaviors of the south Korean authorities criminalizing the just acts to improve the inter-Korean relations and allowing human scum inciting confrontation with fellow countrymen to go scot-free, their poor position of failing to create elementary atmosphere of dialogue and their treacherous acts of joining the U.S. in its moves against national reunification and moves for disturbing dialogue.
					
					 It is nonsensical to allow another long period of the tragedy to last, though the nation has spent 70 years in misfortune and pain.
					
					 The whole world knows well about the will of the DPRK to mercilessly punish the treacherous, anti-peace and anti-reunification acts of the hostile forces.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should ponder over their behavior more than once.
					
					 They should not forget even a moment that all Koreans are following all their moves with high vigilance, ready to punish them.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will resolutely punish the south Korean authorities in case they continue challenging the historic steps taken by it to re-link the severed bonds and blood vessels of the nation and bring about a great change in mending the inter-Korean relations.

articles.title: DPRK FM Blasts Obama's Anti-DPRK Accusations
articles.content:
DPRK FM Blasts Obama's Anti-DPRK Accusations
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK Sunday gave the following answer to the question raised by KCNA as regards a string of accusations again let loose by U.S. President Obama against the DPRK:
					 When interviewed by YouTube manufacturers on Jan. 22, Obama talked about "system change" while slandering the Korean-style socialist system centered on the popular masses.
					
					 He poured a whole gamut of accusations, calling the DPRK the most isolated, solitary and authoritarian country and the cruelest and repressed nation.
					
					 He even talked rubbish that over time internet will find its way to north Korea and the flow of information into it will bring about a change, asserting that they keep exploring ways of speeding up the change.
					
					 We can not but be shocked to find that Obama, president of a "big country," is so preoccupied with the inveterate repugnancy and hostility toward a sovereign state.
					
					 The recent wild remarks made by Obama are nothing but a poor grumble of a loser driven into a tight corner in the all-out stand-off with the DPRK.
					
					 This is little short of admitting himself that the U.S. lacks ability to stifle the DPRK and that a military option is not workable.
					
					 After a series of defeats in its military attempts to stifle the DPRK, the U.S. now turned to internet to undermine the DPRK through the "influx of information".
					
					 It is, however, gravely mistaken if it thinks it can break the single-minded unity of the DPRK, which it failed to do with sanctions and pressure, with internet.
					
					 The more openly the U.S. presses for the moves to undermine the DPRK, the stronger the single-minded unity of the DPRK will be.
					
					 Over time the world will clearly see how the U.S. undergoes decline along with its totally bankrupt hostile policy toward the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Sends Message of Sympathy to Saudi Arabian King
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Sends Message of Sympathy to Saudi Arabian King
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Friday sent a message of sympathy to Salman bin Abdulaziz, king of Saudi Arabia. 
					 The message expressed deep condolences to the king and, through the king, to the government and people of Saudi Arabia and the bereaved family members upon the sad news of death of His Majesty Abdullah bin Abdulaziz. 
					
					 It hoped that the king, government and people of Saudi Arabia would overcome sorrow and achieve big successes for social stability and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong Sends Message of Sympathy to Saudi Arabian FM
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong Sends Message of Sympathy to Saudi Arabian FM
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Ri Su Yong, foreign minister of the DPRK, Friday sent a message of sympathy to his Saudi Arabian counterpart Saud Al Faisal bin Abdulaziz over the death of King Abdullah bin Abdulaziz.
					 The message expressed deep condolences and sympathy to the government and people of Saudi Arabia and the bereaved family members.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Greets Mozambican PM
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Greets Mozambican PM
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju on Jan. 22 sent a congratulatory message to Carlos Agostinho Do Rosario upon his appointment as prime minister of the Republic of Mozambique.
					 Expressing expectation and belief that the long-standing relations between the two countries would grow stronger in all fields including politics, economy and culture, the message wished the prime minister big successes in his responsible work for the economic development and prosperity of the country.
					
					 Meanwhile, DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong sent a congratulatory message to Oldemiro Baloi upon his reappointment as minister of Foreign Affairs and Cooperation of the Republic of Mozambique on the same day.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Congratulates to PM of Mauritius
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Congratulates to PM of Mauritius
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju on Jan. 24 sent a congratulatory message to Anerood Jugnouth upon his election as prime minister of Mauritius.
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, the message wished the prime minister successes in his responsible work for progress and prosperity of the country.
					
					 Meanwhile, DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong sent a congratulatory message to Marie Joseph Nouel Etienne Ghislain Sinatambou upon his appointment as minister of Foreign Affairs, Regional Integration and International Trade of Mauritius on the same day.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong Congratulates to Brazilian FM
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong Congratulates to Brazilian FM
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong sent a congratulatory message to Mauro Luiz Lecker Vieira upon his appointment as minister of Foreign Affairs of Brazil on Jan. 23.
					 Expressing expectation and belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, the message wished the foreign minister successes in his new job.

articles.title: Congratulations to Uganda National Resistance Movement
articles.content:
Congratulations to Uganda National Resistance Movement
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Sunday sent a congratulatory message to the Central Council of the Uganda National Resistance Movement on the occasion of the 29th anniversary of the victory of the movement.
					 Expressing belief that the excellent relations of friendship and cooperation between the Workers' Party of Korea and the Uganda National Resistance Movement would grow stronger in the interests of the two peoples, the message sincerely wished the members of the council greater successes in their work for strengthening the movement and achieving the country's prosperity.

articles.title: Schoolchildren Marching Pass through Hyangsan
articles.content:
Schoolchildren Marching Pass through Hyangsan
 Hyangsan, January 25 (KCNA) -- Schoolchildren from across the country passed through Hyangsan while marching along the course of the 250-mile journey for national liberation that was covered by President Kim Il Sung. The march is being made on the occasions of the 90th anniversary of Kim Il Sung's start of the journey and the 40th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's organizing of the march along the course.
					 After leaving Mangyongdae on Jan. 22, they passed through Kaechon and Kujang along the historic road covered by the President with the lofty aim to save the destiny of the country and nation in the dark days when Korea was under the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule.
					
					 Leading officials of local party and power organs and working people's organizations warmly greeted them and encouraged them while marching with them.
					
					 Marchers looked round the Soson Inn and the Tokgol Revolutionary Site associated with the significant history.
					
					 During a break they held meetings to hear impressions of the reminiscences of anti-Japanese guerrillas they had read and held popular dances, recreation gatherings, etc.
					
					 When they arrived in Hyangsan Town on Jan. 24, they laid a floral basket and bouquets before the statue of the President in the town and bowed to it.
					
					 They left Hyangsan Town for Huichon on Sunday.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for National Unity
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for National Unity
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Sunday insists in an article that achieving national unity is a basic way of solving the national reunification issue in the common interests of the nation. 
					 It has been proved through history that the national unity is the only reasonable and patriotic way for the Korean nation divided into two over more than half a century to carve out the way to national reunification and prosperity and demonstrate the national dignity and honor, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 It is a prerequisite to achieving the national unity that all Koreans in the north and the south transcend the differences in ideology, political view and ism.
					
					 Insistence on one's own ideology and ism will never help achieve the great national unity and mend the inter-Korean relations. 
					
					 This year marks the 15th anniversary of the historic June 15 joint declaration as well as the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					 It is the good way of achieving the great national unity that the north and the south significantly hold national common events and reunification events among those of different social standings to boost the spirit of reunification movement.
					
					 They should activate multilateral contacts and exchanges including the sports and cultural events to re-link the severed ties and blood vessels of the nation and give impetus to achieving the great national unity. 
					
					 All Koreans as well as the authorities in the north and the south should turn out in the movement to achieve the great national unity, being aware of their positions and roles as the masters of national reunification.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blames Japan for Moving to Emerge Military Giant
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blames Japan for Moving to Emerge Military Giant
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The Japanese government is further reinforcing the "Self-Defence Forces" while increasing its military budget for this year.
					 Japan, which is next to the U.S. in the possession of combat forces among the capitalist countries today, has increased its military budget to the maximum. It can not be construed otherwise than an attempt to turn Japan into a military power and launch overseas expansion, Rodong Sinmun Sunday says this in a commentary.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 Japan is more openly seeking to turn it into a military power despite the increasing concern of its surrounding countries and the world community as it is being instigated by the U.S.
					
					 It is an old method employed by the Japanese reactionaries to rush headlong into the overseas aggression, backed by a big country.
					
					 The U.S. is egging its inferior ally on to choose a dangerous path as it stoops to any means and method to use Japan as a shock brigade in realizing its aggressive Asia-Pacific strategy.
					
					 It has actively instigated Japan to exercise the "right to collective self-defense" and give up the "three principles of arms export".
					
					 It is by no means accidental that the Japanese reactionaries are more frantically rushing headlong into a military giant while seeking its military supremacy in the Asia-Pacific region with the U.S.
					
					 Dark clouds of a war are gathering over Northeast Asia due to Japan's reckless moves for a military power and reinvasion.
					
					 Japan that sustained a defeat in the Second World War has opted for a military power, a foolish act that will only precipitate its self-destruction.

articles.title: Improvement of North-South Ties Called for by S. Korean Organization
articles.content:
Improvement of North-South Ties Called for by S. Korean Organization
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Progress of south Korea held a meeting in Seoul on Jan. 21 at which it clarified its will to work hard for the improvement of the inter-Korean relations and the great national unity this year, the 70th anniversary of national division, according to Thongil News, a south Korean internet newspaper.
					 At the meeting the speakers said people of all social standings in the south and the north and abroad should mark August 15 (Korea's liberation) together.
					
					 They also said that they would conduct the movement for having the "May 24 steps" lifted and checking leaflets scattering operations in order to mend south-north relations.
					
					 They called for making preparations for reunification and working out charters for the great national unity participated in by people, not monopolized by the "government".
					
					 They evinced their will to intensify the movement for peace against war to oppose joint military exercises with the U.S.
					
					 They called for forming a democratic front involving all forces standing against the present regime.

articles.title: S. Korean People Stand against Chief Executive
articles.content:
S. Korean People Stand against Chief Executive
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- A south Korean opinion poll institution on Jan. 23 made public the results of the opinion poll it conducted among 1 001 men and women adults across south Korea from Jan. 20 to 22.  
					 The results showed 30 percent of supporting rate for the chief executive, 5 percent fall from a week ago.
					
					 Upset by the daily falling supporting rate, the ruling party and Chongwadae made a fuss to put the situation under control.
					
					 The "Saenuri Party" was all out, promising the implementation of the commitments on Jeju Island, North Chungchong Province and North Jolla Province where they suffered a defeat in the past elections.
					
					 The south Korean people are disillusioned with the dictatorial rule and unpopular policies pursued by the present regime.

articles.title: S. Korean Supreme Court's Unreasonable Decision Flailed
articles.content:
S. Korean Supreme Court's Unreasonable Decision Flailed
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- An editorial titled "Supreme court's decision on case of plotted rebellion" was posted in the south Korean internet newspaper Voice of People on Jan. 23.
					 The editorial said that at a trial on a plotted rebellion case of the Unified Progressive Party (UPP), the supreme court sentenced former lawmaker from the UPP Ri Sok Gi to prison terms.
					
					 The court passed the verdict of guilty on him, charging him with the suspicious agitation for rebellion even though it said there did not exist an "underground revolutionary organization" nor there was suspicion about plotted rebellion, it noted.
					
					 Querying how is it possible to agitate rebellion given no evidence about plotted rebellion, the editorial recalled the public denunciation that the court made the controversial decision by reading face of those in power and conservative media.
					
					 How long the people on this land have to live with their freedom of expression violated, the editorial deplored.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Executive Is to Blame for Crisis: University Professors
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive Is to Blame for Crisis: University Professors
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Professors of Seoul National University made public a declaration on the situation on Jan. 22, according to Kyunghyang Daily News of south Korea.
					 The declaration said that south Korea is now caught in an overall crisis, adding the present chief executive and Chongwadae are to chiefly blame for it.
					
					 Now the "president" is surrounded by incompetent, irresponsible and dangerous figures, the declaration deplored, adding:
					
					 A series of incidents broke out last year but the "government" has not shown responsible attitude.
					
					 The declaration urged the present chief executive to face up to the crisis, carry out overall Cabinet reshuffle and opt for improving the south-north relations.

articles.title: Koreans in Hyogo, Japan Meet
articles.content:
Koreans in Hyogo, Japan Meet
 Tokyo, January 23 (KNS-KCNA) -- Koreans in Hyogo Prefecture, Japan held a meeting in Kobe, Hyogo Prefecture, on Jan. 17 to vow to usher in a new heyday of the movement of Koreans in Japan, deeply cherishing the warm loving care shown by leader Kim Jong Il for the Koreans in Japan when they suffered damage caused by the great Hanshin quake 20 years ago.
					 Present there were Pae Ik Ju, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), Kim Chun Gwon, chairman of the Hyogo Prefectural Headquarters of Chongryon, and other officials, bereaved families and Korean compatriots.
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to the Korean victims.
					
					 Pae Ik Ju said that Kim Jong Il sent a message of sympathy and one million U.S. dollars to Koreans who suffered damage from the great Hanshin quake in 1995. 
					
					 The loving care shown by Kim Jong Il for Koreans in Japan is invariably shedding its rays thanks to Marshal Kim Jong Un, Pae noted.
					
					 He called upon Chongryon officials and Korean compatriots in Hyogo Prefecture to turn out this year marking the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation and the 60th anniversary of the formation of Chongryon in the "innovation movement for greeting the 60th anniversary of the formation of Chongryon with achievements of leaping progress to a new heyday" which is being conducted from the outset of the year by inheriting the patriotic tradition and the spirit with which they overcame huge damage caused by the great quake.
					
					 Kim Chun Gwon expressed his will to glorify the 60th anniversary of Chongryon with signal achievements by giving spurs to the patriotic movement by dint of the single-minded unity under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, bearing deep in mind the loving care and solicitude shown by Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Czech Political Party Supports Kim Jong Un's New Year Address
articles.content:
Czech Political Party Supports Kim Jong Un's New Year Address
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The Standing Committee of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party issued a statement on Jan. 14 in support of the New Year address made by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					 The statement said that Kim Jong Un in his address called for opening up a broad avenue to independent reunification by the concerted efforts of the entire nation this year which marks the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation, thus commanding the admiration of the world. The statement went on:
					
					 He called for conducting brisk dialogue, negotiations, exchanges and contacts between the north and the south, re-linking the severed bonds and blood vessels of the nation and bringing about a great turn in the north-south relations.
					
					 He also said that the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government will strengthen in every way bonds and solidarity with the world progressives loving peace and aspiring after independence and justice and actively develop the good neighborly relations with all those countries that respect the sovereignty of the DPRK and are friendly toward it.
					
					 He also underscored the need to give definite priority to science and technology and bring about a turn in building a socialist economic giant and a highly civilized nation. 
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will surely achieve the final victory on all fronts of building a thriving nation under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 We fully support the just cause of the Korean people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Feats Praised by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Feats Praised by Foreign Media
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Media of various countries carried special write-ups praising the feats of Marshal Kim Jong Un illustrated with his photos.
					 Komsomolskaya Pravda of Russia on December 27 last year devoted one whole page to an article titled "Characteristics of politics of leader Kim Jong Un" and articles sub-titled "Retaliatory blows to provocation" and "Along the road of independence". 
					
					 The newspaper continued: 
					
					 What are the characteristics of the politics pursued by Kim Jong Un who is leading socialist Korea to victory, unfazed by the challenges by the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces and tempests of history?
					
					 Firstly, it is consistent with philosophical thoughts.
					
					 Secondly, it is firm in determination and transparent in faith.
					
					 Thirdly, it is mysterious politics that no one can predict.
					
					 The Myanmar newspaper The New Age on Jan. 6 carried an article titled "Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un seen by the world" highly praising his personality as a great man. 
					
					 The Lao news agency and newspaper Congtap Pasason Lao on Jan. 6 and 8 also introduced the characteristics of his politics.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Ecuador
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Ecuador
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The Ecuadorian national preparatory committee for celebrating the 73rd birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il was formed in Quito on Jan. 19. 
					 Osvaldo Larriva Alvarado, chairman of the Ecuadorian committee for remembering Kim Jong Il, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to organize multifarious political and cultural events praising the sacred revolutionary life and undying feats of Kim Jong Il in the capital and local areas of Ecuador on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star (his birth anniversary).

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Dominica
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Dominica
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- A Dominican preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed in Santo Domingo on January 19.
					 Jose Miguel Mejia, secretary general of the United Left Movement of Dominica, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee. 
					
					 The committee decided to hold political and cultural events praising the sacred revolutionary career of Kim Jong Il and his immortal exploits in the capital and local areas of Dominica on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Russia
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- A Karelia, Russia, preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed on January 20.
					 Viktor Yegorov, chairman of the Karelia-DPRK Friendship Association of Russia, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set the celebration period from Jan. 20 to Feb. 20 and decided to hold a lecture meeting, seminar and other political and cultural events praising the undying exploits of Kim Jong Il during the period.

articles.title: Czech Paper Introduces Architecture of DPRK
articles.content:
Czech Paper Introduces Architecture of DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The Czech newspaper Halo Noviny on January 21 carried an article titled "Architecture for people in DPRK" illustrated with photos showing the panoramic views of the People's Palace of Culture, the People's Theatre and the Rungna People's Pleasure Park.
					 The paper said:
					
					 The word "people" is being carried not only in the name of the country but also in the names of the state and local power bodies, the armed forces and security organs, health institutions at all levels and even in titles of honor and names of edifices.
					
					 The name of the edifice magnificently built on Nam Hill, an excellent location in the centre of Pyongyang, is the Grand People's Study House. Many people visit it regularly.
					
					 The People's Palace of Culture is located on the bank of the Pothong River so that people can visit it to enjoy their cultural and emotional life.
					
					 The modern People's Theatre was built on Changjon Street.
					
					 The name of the pleasure park built on the picturesque bank of the Taedong River is the Rungna People's Pleasure Park.
					
					 A library which was newly built in Kwaksan County is also among the edifices for the people. The three-storeyed library of peculiar style has an e-reading room, a room for combined lecture, science and technology exhibition, etc. It gives free service as just its name "people" implies.
					
					 The DPRK has already enforced people-oriented policies such as a free education system and free medical care from long ago.

articles.title: Iranian Figure Supports Korean People's Just Cause
articles.content:
Iranian Figure Supports Korean People's Just Cause
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Hamid Reza Taraghi, vice-general secretary of the Islamic Coalition Party of Iran, expressed support for the just cause of the Korean people when he met the DPRK ambassador to Iran on January 17. 
					 Referring to the friendly relations between the two countries, he affirmed the will to always remember the Korean people's support for the cause of the Iranian people. 
					
					 The Workers' Party of Korea has displayed the spirit of strong resistance in exploring ways to tide over the economic ordeals, thus protecting the Korean people from threats and sanctions, he said, and went on:
					
					 The military strength of the DPRK was provided by the preceding leaders. The might will surely lead the country to an economic and cultural might. We will always support the struggle of the Korean people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Lauded by Ecuadorian Personage
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Lauded by Ecuadorian Personage
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Generalissimo Kim Jong Il was the great thinker and theoretician and prominent statesman who performed immortal exploits for the Korean revolution and world socialism. 
					 Osvaldo Larriva Alvarado, chairman of the Ecuadorian committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il, said this at an inaugural ceremony of the Ecuadorian national preparatory committee for celebrating the 73rd birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il on January 19. 
					
					 He went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Il devoted all his life to the country's prosperity and happiness of its people and turned the DPRK into a political, ideological and military power with the far-reaching goal to glorify Korea true to the cause of President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 The inauguration of the preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il is an expression of the highest tribute to him. 
					
					 Osvaldo Larriva Alvarado extended invariable support and solidarity to the Korean people working hard to build a thriving socialist nation and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea under the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Dominican Political Personage
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Dominican Political Personage
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The great Comrade Kim Jong Il was the teacher of progressives as he made undying contributions to the cause of global independence. 
					 Jose Miguel Mejia, secretary general of the United Left Movement of Dominica, said this at an inaugural ceremony of the Dominican preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) on January 19. 
					
					 He went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Il was a prominent and brilliant commander who defeated the U.S. imperialists' moves to stifle the DPRK and led the struggle for defending the country to victory with the united efforts of the army and people of the DPRK. 
					
					 He devoted all his life to defending the country and promoting people's welfare against imperialism. 
					
					 Today the Korean people are invariably advancing along the road of independence against imperialism under the wise leadership of HE Kim Jong Un, another prominent great man.

articles.title: New Year Address Reported by Int' Organization and Various Countries
articles.content:
New Year Address Reported by Int' Organization and Various Countries
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The New Year address made by Marshal Kim Jong Un was reported by international organization and media of various countries from Jan. 7 to 20.
					 The Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain posted the full text of the address on its homepage illustrated with a photo of Kim Jong Un making his address.
					
					 The Uruguayan newspaper La Juventud and a Swedish magazine carried the part dealing with Korea's reunification from the address illustrated with his photo.
					
					 The British newspaper Workers' Weekly, the Pakistani newspaper Election Times, the Brazilian newspaper Hora do Povo and the internet homepage of the Brazilian committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il also carried the part dealing with Korea's reunification from the New Year address.

articles.title: DP de CDN aclara posicion de principios a autoridades surcoreanas
articles.content:
DP de CDN aclara posicion de principios a autoridades surcoreanas
Pyongyang, 25 de enero (ACNC) -- Es tan ardiente el deseo unanime de todos los connacionales de escribir nuevamente la historia de relaciones intercoreanas rompiendo con el pasado desagradable en acato al gran proposito del Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					Tambien los pueblos del mundo envian el apoyo y la solidaridad al historico llamamiento de eliminar el peligro de guerra y preparar el ambiente pacifico en la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					Sin embargo, solo las relaciones intercoreanas no se liberan de la congelacion ni se prepara el ambiente de dialogo mas elemental.
					
					Al respecto, el Departamento de Politica del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en la declaracion fechada hoy aclaro la posicion de principios que sigue:
					
					1. Las autoridades surcoreanas no deben interpretar ni hablar a su antojo de las medidas nacionales de la RPDC.
					
					El gran llamamiento hecho en el comienzo del ano nuevo contiene la ardiente sinceridad de dar punto final a la historia de division nacional de 70 anos que sigue siglo a siglo y adelantar la construccion de la digna y prospera potencia reunificada sobre este territorio patrio. 
					
					Pero, a instigacion de su amo gringo, las autoridades surcoreanas las interpretan a su capricho y las cuestionan atrevidamente en vez de analizar profundamente y respaldar activamente.
					
					Acusan esas medidas historicas aplaudidas altamente por toda la nacion coreana de "opcion tomada para salir del aislamiento internacional", "ultima medida para escaparse del bloqueo economico" y "ofensiva de paz para causar conflictos entre los surcoreanos".
					
					Y se atreven a calificarlas de "propuesta igual a las anteriores", "medida carente de sinceridad" y "artimana para tomar la iniciativa".
					
					No presentamos nuevas medidas bajo el calculo algo. Tampoco las tomamos para liberarse de las dificultades economicas, el aislamiento y  el bloque.
					
					Las fuerzas hostiles deben saber correctamente que el aislamiento politico, la asfixia economica y el aplastamiento militar nunca surtiran efecto en la RPDC.
					
					No nos beneficiamos nunca de Estados Unidos ni pensamos en la mejora de nuestra vida en virtud de las autoridades surcoreanas.
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas no deben malinterpretar ni burlar nuestra sinceridad y la voluntad de acabar con la historia de division nacional que sufre solamente la nacion coreana. 
					
					2. Las autoridades surcoreanas no deben cometer los delitos que desesperan a todos los compatriotas con las palabras y acciones diferentes.
					
					Ahora las autoridades surcoreanas hablan ruidosamente del dialogo N-S y de la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas.
					
					La mandataria dice que "pondra punto final a 70 anos de division caracterizados por la ruptura y discordia" y habla en alta voz de la "ampliacion de los preparativos para la unificacion", "la preparacion de condiciones para la apertura de dialogo de cualquier forma", la "inauguracion ejemplar de los ferrocarriles que atraviesan la Peninsula Coreana", el dialogo y negociaciones sobre "la apertura de 3 vias: vida del pueblo, ambiente y cultura" y la "realizacion prioritaria" del encuentro de familiares y parientes separados en el Norte y el Sur.
					
					Pero, la accion se diferencia completamente de aquellas palabras dulces.
					
					Ella ya declaro que desde a principios de marzo se desplegaran los ejercicios militares conjuntos "Key Resolve" y "Foal Eagle" y en agosto el otro "Ulji Freedom Guardian" enganando la opinion publica como si tales entrenamientos belicos no tuvieran relaciones con la eliminacion de peligro de guerra y la preparacion del ambiente pacifico.
					
					Bajo el pretexto de garantizar plenamente la "posicion de defensa combinada" lisonjeando a su amo norteamericano, introduce invariablemente en el suelo surcoreano y su contorno las fuerzas agresivas como la aviacion de bombarderos estrategicos cargados de bombas nucleares con el fin de romper a toda costa el ambiente de mejora de relaciones intercoreanas.
					
					Lo problematico es que tales movimientos, que persiguen completar los preparativos de ataque preventivo anti-RPDC, se tornan mas abiertos con motivo del 65o aniversario de la concertacion del "acuerdo de apoyo de defensa mutua" Surcorea-EE.UU., de caracter humillante y vendepatria.
					
					3. Las autoridades surcoreanas deben saber correctamente que no podran evitar el castigo duro si niegan obstinadamente el historico llamamiento de la RPDC.
					
					La mejora y  el desarrollo de las relaciones intercoreanas resultan una tarea impostergable de la epoca.
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas deben sumarse con sinceridad al llamamiento de la RPDC de abrir el ancho camino para la reunificacion independiente.
					
					No se tolerara nunca la actitud incapacitada de ellas que dejan intactas a las escorias humanas que agitan la confrontacion fratricida, criminalizando los actos justos para la mejora de relaciones N-S, que no preparan ni siquiera el ambiente elemental para el dialogo y se suman al complot anti-reunificacion de EE.UU. y a sus abiertas maniobras para estorbar el dialogo.
					
					Nunca es permisible que repitan otra vez las incontables desagracias y sufrimientos de 70 anos.
					
					Todo el mundo ya conoce la voluntad de castigo despiadado de la RPDC a las acciones antinacionales, antipacificos y anti-reunificacion de las fuerzas hostiles.
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas deben deliberarlo profundamente.
					
					No deben olvidar ni un momento que todos los coreanos estan observando con la mirada fria los movimientos de las autoridades surcoreanas manteniendo la disposicion de castigo.
					
					El ejercito y pueblo de la RPDC responderan con castigos duros en el caso de que sigan desafiando a las medidas historicas, para reconectar el lazo y la arteria nacionales y traer gran cambio en las relaciones intercoreanas.

articles.title: Portavoz de MINREX de RPDC condena disparates de Obama
articles.content:
Portavoz de MINREX de RPDC condena disparates de Obama
Pyongyang, 25 de enero (ACNC) -- En relacion con que el presidente norteamericano Obama volvio a calumniar la RPDC, el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea respondio hoy a la ACNC como sigue:
					En una entrevista sostenida el pasado dia 22 con los elaboradores de YouTube, Obama hablo del "cambio del regimen" de la RPDC difamando astutamente su regimen socialista centrado en las masas populares.
					
					La califico de "estado mas aislado y solitario" en este mundo terraqueo, "gobierno dictatorial" y "pais mas bestial y represivo".
					
					Y agrego que "con el paso de tiempo se infiltrara el Internet en el Norte de Corea y el flujo de informaciones obtendra su cambio" y que "sigue buscando las maneras para acelerar ese cambio".
					
					Nos quedamos muy consternados ante el hecho de que la cabeza de Obama, presidente de "potencia", esta llena de morbido pensamiento negativo y la hostilidad a un estado soberano.
					
					Los presentes disparates de Obama no son mas que una picoteria de un vencido que se encuentra en un aprieto en la confrontacion total con la RPDC.
					
					Los palabrotes de Obama testimonian que el mismo reconocio que su pais tiene la capacidad limitada en aplastar la RPDC y que la opcion militar no surte efecto.
					
					Despues de sufrir seguidamente fracasos en su intento de sofocarla con las fuerzas militares, el pais norteamericano trata de descomponerla desde el interior con el "flujo de informaciones" por via Internet.
					
					Es una vana ilusion el intento de EE.UU. de romper con Internet la unidad monolitica de la RPDC.
					
					Cuanto mas se tornen mas abiertas las maniobras de EE.UU. encaminadas a descomponerla tanto mas se consolidara la unidad monolitica de la RPDC.
					
					Con el paso del tiempo, el mundo experimentara claramente el fracaso general de la politica hostil anti-RPDC de Estados Unidos y su destruccion total.
